attributes.action: Regulate the use of AI generated footage in the public domain
attributes.additional_details: I feel that it has become increasingly difficult to tell fact from fiction. The potential for harm is considerable. We are often fed misinformation on any range of topics. Take recent examples like brexit where certain individuals twisted narratives to suit their own agendas. Also, fake footage showing police brutality/ineptitude which undermines public trust. Imagine the possible damage in the run up to an election or the potential damage caused to innocent people. This needs to be controlled.
attributes.background: I would like legislation passed which forces anyone posting AI generated content to clearly show that the footage is AI generated, either by means of an AI logo clearly displayed throughout the footage or a disclaimer at the start of the footage with financial penalties for anyone found in breach.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions, which call for similar action: 

"Require generative AI watermarks & ban using people’s likeness without consent"
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/736690

"Mandate labelling of Al-generated videos in metadata and online"
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/747437

"Require all AI musicians and songs to have a visible AI notice"
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/753997

"Require companies to disclose when they use AI for advertising"
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/744204
